perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect until the end of the fifteenth (15th) Contract Year, and shall continue in full force and effect thereafter until terminated by either Party by providing thirty (30) calendar days' prior written notice of termination to the other Party (such fifteen (15) Contract Year period, as may be further extended as provided herein is referred to as the "Term").
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect until the end of the fifteenth (15th) Contract Year. Either party may terminate this agreement at any time with no prior written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specified the initial term and renewal process that includes a 30-day written notice. The modified version contradicts this by allowing either party to terminate the agreement at any time without any prior notice, creating uncertainty about the duration and termination conditions of the contract.

perturbation.original_text: 16.1 Restrictions on Assignment. This Agreement may not be assigned, disposed of, alienated or otherwise transferred by either Party, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed, except as provided below.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.1 Restrictions on Assignment. This Agreement may be freely assigned, disposed of, alienated or otherwise transferred by either Party, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricted assignment with the need of other party approval. The modified version contradicts this by removing the condition of other party consent completely, creating uncertainty about the control a party has over their contracts.

perturbation.original_text: 18.1 Notice. Any notice, statement, payment, claim or other communication required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and shall be sent by: (i) facsimile transmission; (ii) delivered by hand; (iii) sent by United States mail with all postage fully prepaid; or (iv) by courier with charges paid in accordance with the customary arrangements established by such courier, in each of the foregoing cases addressed to the Party at the following addresses:
perturbation.changed_text: 18.1 Notice. Any notice, statement, payment, claim or other communication required or permitted hereunder can be communicated with or without writing with any type of medium either electronically, verbally, or physically to the other party. The method of communication used, the time of day, and the intended recipient is solely at the discretion of the communicating party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricts communication to being written and provided methods of delivery with defined addresses. The modified version completely removes any restriction on communication either verbally or in writing and does not include any addresses. This creates uncertainty about which communication is valid or how to make a claim in a legally binding way.
